meanings.definition: The quality or standard of something
meanings.sent1: Her work is of high caliber, always meeting the expectations.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's food is of excellent caliber, attracting many customers.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat's behavior is of such a high caliber that it amazes everyone.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft is of a caliber that shines brighter than the rest.
meanings.sent5: The caliber of the singer's voice resonated through the entire hall.

meanings.definition: The diameter of a bullet or gun barrel
meanings.sent1: The gunsmith measured the caliber of the bullet carefully.
meanings.sent2: The police officer identified the caliber of the gun used in the crime.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a way to solve the case using the caliber of the bullet.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the shooter's aim matched the caliber of the gun.
meanings.sent5: The caliber of the bullet determined the damage it could cause.

meanings.definition: A person's ability or level of skill
meanings.sent1: Her caliber in mathematics made her the top student in the class.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's caliber was evident in every game he played.
meanings.sent3: Even the clown's caliber in juggling surprised the audience.
meanings.sent4: His caliber in negotiation helped him seal the deal successfully.
meanings.sent5: The caliber of the chef's cooking skills impressed the food critics.
